org.xbib.elasticsearch.river.jdbc.strategy.simple

Class SimpleValueListener<O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xbib.elasticsearch.river.jdbc.strategy.simple.SimpleValueListener<O>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValueListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TableValueListener

    public class SimpleValueListener<O>
extends Object
implements ValueListener
    The SimpleValueListener class consumes values from a database and transports them to the river target.

      • merge

        protected Map<String,Values<O>> merge(Map map,
                          String key,
                          Object value)
        Merge key/value pair to a map holding a JSON object. The key consists of a path pointing to the value position in the JSON object. The key, representing a path, is divided into head/tail. The recursion terminates if there is only a head and no tail. In this case, the value is added as a tuple to the map. If the head key exists, the merge process is continued by following the path represented by the key. If the path does not exist, a new map is created. A conflict arises if there is no map at a head key position. Then, the prefix given in the path is considered illegal.
        Parameters:
        map - the map for the JSON object
        key - the key
        value - the value
